channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: What’s the true toll of COVID-19?
item.description: The WHO says the pandemic has killed nearly 15 million people in the first two years.

item.title: State of emergency declared in Sri Lanka as strike halts country
item.description: Emergency powers allow deployment of troops to maintain law and order in addition to the police force.

item.title: Posters in Moscow accuse famous Swedes of backing Nazism
item.description: Russian posters accuse some of the 20th century's most famous Swedes of supporting Nazism.

item.title: Pentagon denies helping Ukraine sink Russian ship Moskva
item.description: The sinking of Russia's flagship Moskva missile cruiser last month was a high-profile failure for its military.

item.title: UN warns Africa faces ‘unprecedented’ crisis due to Ukraine war
item.description: Rising prices and the slowdown in economic growth are putting millions of households at risk across the continent.

item.title: As El Salvador’s arrest wave continues, families live in worry
item.description: Relatives of people arrested in government's crackdown on gangs say they have little to no information about loved ones.

item.title: Nvidia pays $5.5m SEC fine over crypto-mining disclosures
item.description: The chipmaker did not adequately disclose revenue from crypto mining, the US Securities and Exchange Commission said.

item.title: Israel set to approve 4,000 settler units in occupied West Bank
item.description: If approved, it would be the biggest advancement of illegal settlement plans since US President Joe Biden took office.

item.title: At least 8 dead after explosion rocks hotel in downtown Havana
item.description: Cuban president's office says preliminary investigation indicates blast at Hotel Saratoga was caused by gas leak.

item.title: Brazil sets another Amazon deforestation record, prompting alarm
item.description: Environmentalists say Amazon loss in April, equivalent to 1,400 football fields, is very high for this time of year.

item.title: US sanctions North Korean cryptocurrency mixer Blender
item.description: The sanctions, imposed by the United States Treasury Department, are the first ever on a digital asset mixing service.

item.title: Europe a key global hub for billion-dollar cocaine market: Report
item.description: An estimated 14 million adults in the EU aged 15 to 65 have tried cocaine, and sales of the drug hit $11.1bn in 2020.

item.title: Evacuations resume from besieged plant in Mariupol
item.description: Dozens of civilians evacuated from Azovstal plant hours after Russia was accused of violating a ceasefire.

item.title: Nigeria’s central bank chief to run for presidency in 2023
item.description: There's been a multitude of interest from heavyweights and has-beens to succeed Muhammadu Buhari as Nigerian president.

item.title: South Africa launches world’s biggest hydrogen-fuelled truck
item.description: A number of countries have pledged $8.5bn and technical assistance to help South Africa become a low-carbon economy.

item.title: UK pushes tough tech rules under new digital watchdog
item.description: The Digital Markets Unit is aimed at giving consumers more choice online.

item.title: US stocks fall as jobs data adds to rate hike jitters
item.description: The Federal Reserve is expected to keep a firm grip on monetary policy amid a still tight labour market.

item.title: Why is Ukraine trying to cancel Russian culture?
item.description: Ukraine has ramped up its de-Russification efforts, but figures like Tolstoy and Pushkin were also targeted by Russia.

item.title: China makes second largest incursion into Taiwan air defence zone
item.description: Eighteen aircraft, including fighters and bombers, entered Taiwan's air defence zone, prompting the scrambling of jets.

item.title: Saudi-led coalition sends dozens of freed prisoners to Yemen
item.description: Coalition says 108 detainees were flown on Friday from Saudi Arabia to the southern Yemeni city of Aden.

item.title: UK’s Labour leader to be probed over ‘beergate’ allegations
item.description: Police says 'significant new information' prompted the decision to probe Keir Starmer over lockdown rule-breaking.

item.title: US sees strong job gains in April while wage growth moderates
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls increased 428,000 in April, matching the prior month, a Labor Department report showed on Friday.

item.title: Somalia: Lawmakers to decide president on May 15
item.description: The election process was destabilised by al-Shabab attacks as well as feuding between the president and the PM.

item.title: Russia: What is Victory Day, and why is it important this May 9?
item.description: Russia will celebrate the Soviet Union’s victory over Nazi Germany as its new war on Ukraine rages.

item.title: In Zimbabwe, conflict escalates between elephants and humans
item.description: Intensified competition for food and water in dry season has resulted in conflicts among the animals, and with humans.
